summary: Experienced Senior Researcher / Lecturer / Project coordinator with a demonstrated history of working in the higher education industry. Strong education professional skilled in Sustainable Development, Corporate Social Responsibility, Energy Policy, Energy Efficiency.

awards.title: Hugenotenprijs
awards.description: Hogeschool Utrecht (HU) reikt jaarlijks de HUgenotenprijs uit aan mensen die een buitengewone bijdrage hebben geleverd aan de hogeschool.

projects.title: EC H2020 ENPOR Actions to Mitigate Energy Poverty in the Private Rented Sector
projects.description: Energy poverty remains at high levels in the EU Member States due to increasing energy costs and slow progress on energy efficiency improvements. Despite various policies in place that directly or indirectly mitigate energy poverty in the household level, energy poverty is increasing in the private rented sector (PRS). The PRS also presents quite specific issues that cannot be dealt adequately in the framework of energy poverty linked directly to energy efficiency, such as a) difficulty to identify and quantify energy poor households in the PRS; and b) the delivery of energy efficiency measures to these households is difficult due to structural problems like information deficits, split incentives and others. ENPOR thus aims to overcome both challenges – making energy poverty in the PRS visible and as far as possible quantifiable, and also test energy efficiency support schemes to address it. This can increase the effectiveness of policies at a local or regional level, an alignment with structural measures is needed. Dedicated actions are therefore needed that actively contribute to alleviating energy poverty in the PRS by identifying energy poor tenants (and respective homeowners) as well as understanding and addressing their needs. TO this end, ENPOR will support the adaption and implementation of ten policies in 7 Member States tailored to the specific needs of the PRS and will integrate them into broader policy objectives. To achieve that, ENPOR will examine in depth energy poverty policies for the PRS across the EU, Monitor the dimensions of energy poverty in the PRS, support tailored policies and will provide guidelines for other countries. Through ENPOR partners links with the Covenant of Mayors, EU Energy Poverty Observatory and market (Union of Tenants and Associations of homeowners), the high-level dialogue on the EU level for the energy poverty in the PRS will be promoted.

projects.title: Transform-CE
projects.description: De doelstellingen van TRANSFORM-CE zijn de ontwikkeling van een eigen recyclingeconomie voor plastics in Europa, de afhankelijkheid van importmarkten verminderen, bestaande plastics recyclen, vraag naar hergebruikte producten creëren en de afvalstorting van waardevol plastic voorkomen. Het project bestaat uit een consortium van kennisinstellingen, overheden, en bedrijven uit Groot-Brittannië, Nederland, Belgie en Duitsland. Vanuit de Hogeschool Utrecht zullen participeren: Center of Expertise Smart Sustainable Cities, Lectoraat Codesign, Lectoraat Microsysteem Technology.

projects.title: Article 7 of the EED directive
projects.description: Technical assistance on assessing progress in implementing article 7 of energy efficiency directive and preparing the policy implementation in view of the new obligation period 2021-2030

projects.title: ENSMOV
projects.description: ENSMOV (Enhancing the Implementation and Monitoring and Verification practices of Energy Saving Policies under Article 7 of the Energy Efficiency Directive (EED)) is a European Commission Horizon 2020 project, aiming to provide support to Member States and their stakeholders to implement energy efficiency policies. More specifically, in the next three years we will help Member States to monitor, revise, improve and implement their energy efficiency policies by developing resources on practical and strategic issues arising from the Article 7 of the Energy Efficiency Directive (EED).

projects.title: Sustainability Alliance of Urban Networks in Asian Cities (SAUNAC)
projects.description: Sustainability Alliance of Urban Networks in Asian Cities (SAUNAC) is funded by the European Union’s ERASMUS+ programme and is a partnership of 5 European and 6 Vietnamese universities. The activity aims to build the capacity of the universities in Vietnam and their stakeholders to give them the tools to enable a transition in Vietnam through a number of activities that educate professionals and students to develop viable solutions for smart sustainable cities.

projects.title: Comenius Teaching Fellow project on building a community of practices for Smart Sustainable Cities
projects.description: In this Comenius teaching fellow project, the education in the Smart Sustainable Cities minor is being innovated by further developing the minor as a Community of Practice (CoP). A CoP is a group of people who share an interest, an issue or a passion for a certain topic and who deepen knowledge and expertise in this area by constantly interacting with each other. The development of a CoP is seen as an innovative solution for strengthening co-operative learning, facilitating knowledge accumulation and connecting stakeholders. In this project, the CoP is shaped by 1) the development of cooperative learning activities, 2) the development of an instrument for knowledge accumulation, and 3) the development of a communication platform for the CoP. Three specific methods are proposed for this: 1) methods and techniques for Computer Supported Collaborative learning (CSCL); 2) the development of pattern language for the description of realized educational and research output; and 3) the 5D model for designing and managing sustainable CoPs. The innovation of the project is the development of a CoP as a rich learning environment, which results from a better link with practice, a better social solidarity, aimed at sustainable regional and international cooperation on the theme of Smart Sustainable Cities. Ultimately, the goal is to develop a learning CoP based on collaboration between education and professional practice. The development of a CoP as a rich learning environment fits in seamlessly with the strategic agenda for higher education and research.

projects.title: Lectorenplatform Smart Cities and Citizens
projects.description: This project aims at: 1) enhancing the network on smart city & citizens; 2) connecting practical questions with practice-oriented research and design; 3) prioritize research and design tasks for the smart city & citizens theme; 4) stimulate current education on solving practical issues in cities.

projects.title: ZERO CU
projects.description: Het living lab ZERO CU is gericht op de ontwikkeling van een zero-emission multimodale circulaire hub voor aan- en afvoer van bouw- resp. sloopmateriaal in de industriële havenzone Lage Weide voor de stad Utrecht. Nadruk ligt op elektrisch en waterstof aangedreven zelfvarende scheepvaart. Het betrokken praktijknetwerk bestaat o.a. uit logistieke, bouw- en sloopbedrijven op Lage Weide, gemeente Utrecht en Rijkswaterstaat. Bouwtransporten van en naar de stad worden gebundeld, en verzameling en bewerking van bouw- en sloopafval worden gecombineerd. De circulaire hub wordt ontwikkeld als een innovatieve onderzoeks- en testlocatie voor multimodale stadsdistributie, bundeling en bewerking van bouw/sloopmaterialen, en zero emission energie.

projects.title: European Sustainable Solutions for Existing and New City Environments (ESSENCE)
projects.description: The ESSENCE strategic partnership aims to achieve employability, skills for new business creation, active participation of young people in society and an increased sense of initiative and (social) entrepreneurship. ESSENCE Stands for European Sustainable Solutions for Existing and New City Environments. HU works with the four other European higher education institutions from the CARPE network (Valencia, Turku, Manchester, Hamburg) and three regional governments (Utrecht, Alcoi, Turku) as part of an Erasmus KA2 project.

contributors.headline: Pensionada, ex-programmamanager Kenniscentrum Gezond en Duurzaam Leven bij Hogeschool Utrecht

projects.title: Inzichten boven water halen. De CO2 Prestatieladder in de waterbouwsector
projects.description: This project was commissioned by RWS, SKAO and VvW. It aimed at analysing CO2 emissions in the civil engineering sector, the relevance of CO2 emissions in the supply chain, the costs of implementing the CO2 Perfomance Ladder, and getting insight in the pros and cons of the CO2 Perfomance Ladder.

projects.title: Evaluating the Impacts of the CO2 Performance Ladder
projects.description: Research project on evaluating the impacts of the CO2 Performance Ladder on reducing CO2 emissions, enhancing the uptake of energy saving measures and improving energy management in construction industry.
